title: How To Use Amazon Ads Data To Find Low Competition Keywords With High Demand

tactics.name: Amazon Ads Keyword Validation
tactics.description: Use Amazon Ads data to identify low-competition keywords with high demand by analyzing targets and ad group performance.
steps: Check targets (substitutes, complements, loose match, close match) in Amazon Ads dashboard
Review ad group keywords for search volume and competition metrics
Validate keywords using Publisher Rocket for search volume and competition data
caveats: Data may not reflect post-launch performance
source_quotes: I spent two hours on it because I felt really confident...

heuristics.name: Low Competition Boost
heuristics.condition: If search volume is under 1,000 and competition is low, prioritize keyword
source_quotes: I typically don't consider making a book for keywords under a thousand searches...

claims.statement: Niche markets offer higher profitability than broad categories
source_quotes: The more closely you can niche down the more money you make

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identities with problems and constraints to create targeted niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates low-competition, high-demand niches with clear market needs
source_quotes: I'm interested in these little tiny categories of niches because I believe there's niches there's riches...
